intro: Houstonia nigricans, commonly known as blackfooted bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodlands and along stream banks. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Houstonia nigricans is often found in shaded environments and is considered a valuable component of native plant ecosystems.
